diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Renal-cell carcinoma, endocarditis, mesenteric ischemia, diverticulitis, glomerulonephritis, systemic vasculitis, aortic graft infection
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The presence of a purpuric rash, hematuria, abdominal pain, and evidence of renal failure were key to the diagnosis. The identification of red-cell casts on urinalysis, which were found only on a repeated analysis, confirmed the diagnosis of glomerular disease. Abdominal imaging raised concerns for diverticulitis, but the purpuric rash and subsequent biopsy indicated a vasculitic process consistent with Schönlein–Henoch purpura.
